summary: This document is an email chain from 2020-2021 between Assistant U.S. Attorney Maurene Comey and attorney Jeff Jocks regarding a subpoena to Interlochen Center for the Arts. The subpoena sought records of tuition payments made by Jeffrey Epstein or his entities for students. Jocks, representing Interlochen, repeatedly states the institution has no such records, as they only keep payment information for 7 years.

persons.name: Jeffrey L. Jocks
persons.role: Attorney representing Interlochen Center for the Arts
persons.context: Attorney from Sondee, Racine & Doren, PLC who is responding to a federal subpoena on behalf of Interlochen Center for the Arts, stating the institution has no records of tuition payments by Epstein or his entities.

persons.name: Maurene Comey
persons.context: Federal prosecutor from the Southern District of New York who is leading the inquiry and issuing the subpoena to Interlochen Center for the Arts for records related to Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The deceased financier who is the subject of the federal investigation; the subpoena seeks records of any tuition payments he or his entities made for students at Interlochen.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Epstein's associate who is also named as a subject of the investigation in the subpoena for records from Interlochen Center for the Arts.

persons.name: George B. Donnini
persons.context: Copied on an email from Maurene Comey; appears to be another legal professional involved in the correspondence regarding the Interlochen subpoena.

connections.description: Prosecutor issuing a subpoena to an institution represented by attorney Jocks, with ongoing professional correspondence regarding document production.
Both are named as subjects of the federal investigation in the subpoena for records from Interlochen Center for the Arts.
Jocks is the legal representative for Interlochen Center for the Arts, responding to the federal subpoena on their behalf.

events.title: Subpoena issued to Interlochen
events.description: Assistant U.S. Attorney Maurene Comey sends a subpoena to Interlochen Center for the Arts seeking information regarding Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Attorney call scheduled
events.description: Maurene Comey and Jeff Jocks schedule a call to discuss the subpoena response regarding tuition payment records.

events.title: Interlochen's final response
events.description: Jeff Jocks formally states Interlochen has no documents regarding tuition payments by Epstein or his entities, as they only keep records for 7 years.

keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office subpoenaed Interlochen Center for the Arts for records of tuition payments made by Jeffrey Epstein or his entities for students.
Interlochen's attorney, Jeff Jocks, stated the institution only keeps tuition payment information for 7 years and found no records of payments by Epstein or Epstein entities.
The subpoena explicitly sought information regarding both Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell.
The email chain shows persistent follow-up by federal prosecutors from April 2020 through January 2021 to confirm the completeness of Interlochen's document production.
The correspondence emphasizes confidentiality, with the prosecutor requesting Interlochen keep the subpoena confidential.
